snippet: The practice, which is not illegal, was called a scourge last month in local voting, but raises questions about the frailty of the nation’s democracy.
abstract: Widespread practice of vote-buying in Argentina has come under increased scrutiny in advance of upcoming parliamentary and presidential elections and has raised concerns about strength of country's democracy; election observers have outlined extent of practice, which is not actually illegal.
lead_paragraph: The practice, which is not illegal, was called a scourge last month in local voting, but raises questions about the frailty of the nation’s democracy.

headline.print_headline: Argentine Vote-Buying Practice Under New Scrutiny as Presidential Elections Near
headline.main: New Scrutiny on Vote Buying as Argentine Elections Near
